description: Button component with 4 variants (primary/secondary/ghost/destructive) and 3 sizes using Auto Layout
example: Variant grid: Variant=primary/secondary/ghost/destructive × Size=sm/md/lg × State=default/hover/focus/disabled/loading
anti_pattern: Single button frame duplicated manually for each state
tailwind_mapping: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 h-9 px-4 rounded-md

description: Badge component with semantic color variants mapped to status values
example: Variant=default/success/warning/destructive/outline using color tokens not raw hex
anti_pattern: Using raw hex colors instead of Variables
tailwind_mapping: bg-green-500/10 text-green-700 border border-green-200 rounded-full px-2 py-0.5 text-xs

description: Input field with 5 explicit states using border color tokens
example: State=default(border/border) focus(border/primary) error(border/destructive) disabled(bg/muted) filled(text present)
anti_pattern: Missing error state — only default and focus defined
tailwind_mapping: border border-input bg-background rounded-md px-3 h-9 text-sm focus:border-ring

description: FormField composing Label + Input + HelperText as vertical Auto Layout
example: Gap: 6px between Label and Input, 4px between Input and HelperText. HelperText color switches from muted-foreground to destructive in error state
anti_pattern: Positioning label/input/helper independently without Auto Layout

description: StatCard with icon + large value + label + optional delta badge
example: Auto Layout vertical, gap-2, padding-16. Value: text-2xl font-bold. Label: text-sm text-muted-foreground. Delta: Badge with +/- prefix
anti_pattern: Fixed pixel positioning instead of Auto Layout
tailwind_mapping: p-4 rounded-lg border bg-card flex flex-col gap-2

description: DataTable with header row + data rows + empty state + pagination
example: Column headers: font-medium text-muted-foreground text-xs uppercase. Rows: hover:bg-muted/50. Empty: centered icon + message + optional CTA
anti_pattern: No empty state defined — undefined behavior when data is empty

description: Navigation sidebar with logo + nav items + user footer
example: Width: 240px fixed. NavItems: horizontal Auto Layout gap-2 icon+label, active=bg-accent. Bottom: user avatar + name + logout
anti_pattern: Sidebar with absolute positioned items — breaks on resize
tailwind_mapping: w-60 flex flex-col border-r bg-card h-screen

description: Dashboard layout with sidebar + topbar + scrollable content area
example: Sidebar: 240px fixed left. Topbar: 56px fixed top. Content: flex-1 overflow-y-auto. Three-column inner grid: 8-column main + 4-column aside
anti_pattern: Full page layout in single frame without proper constraints

description: Figma Variables mapped to CSS custom properties and Tailwind config
example: background→--background, foreground→--foreground, primary→--primary, muted→--muted, border→--border, card→--card, destructive→--destructive
anti_pattern: Using raw hex in component colors instead of Variable aliases

description: Spacing tokens as multiples of 4px base unit mapped to Tailwind scale
example: space-1=4px p-1, space-2=8px p-2, space-4=16px p-4, space-6=24px p-6, space-8=32px p-8
anti_pattern: Arbitrary pixel values not matching 4px grid

description: Typography tokens: size + weight + line-height mapped to Tailwind text scale
example: xs=12px/16px, sm=14px/20px, base=16px/24px, lg=18px/28px, xl=20px/28px, 2xl=24px/32px. Weights: normal=400 medium=500 semibold=600 bold=700
anti_pattern: Arbitrary font sizes not on the scale — creates visual inconsistency
tailwind_mapping: text-xs text-sm text-base text-lg text-xl text-2xl font-normal font-medium font-semibold font-bold

description: Border radius tokens mapped to Tailwind rounded scale
example: sm=4px rounded-sm, md=8px rounded-md, lg=12px rounded-lg, xl=16px rounded-xl, full=9999px rounded-full
anti_pattern: Inconsistent radius values across components — some 6px some 8px some 10px

description: Card component Auto Layout recipe
example: Outer: Vertical Auto Layout, padding=16px, gap=12px, hug-height, fill-width. Inner row: Horizontal, space-between. Border: 1px Variables/border
anti_pattern: Fixed height card — breaks when content wraps
tailwind_mapping: p-4 rounded-lg border bg-card flex flex-col gap-3

description: Horizontal list with wrapping for responsive
example: Wrap=Wrap, gap=8px horizontal 8px vertical, padding=0. Items hug content
anti_pattern: Non-wrapping horizontal row — overflows on mobile

description: Page section with max-width constraint and centered content
example: Outer: Fill width. Inner: Max-width=1280px, margin auto, padding=0 24px. Content: Vertical Auto Layout
anti_pattern: Section at full bleed without max-width — too wide on large screens

description: Button loading state with spinner replacing label
example: Spinner: 16px circle stroke animation. Label hidden in loading state. Width stays fixed (avoid layout shift). State=Loading in variant grid
anti_pattern: Loading state that changes button width — causes layout jump

description: Empty state component with icon + heading + subtext + optional CTA
example: Centered in container. Icon: 48px muted-foreground. Heading: text-lg font-semibold. Sub: text-sm text-muted-foreground. CTA: ghost button
anti_pattern: Empty state just showing plain text 'No data' — missed opportunity for guidance
tailwind_mapping: flex flex-col items-center justify-center gap-3 py-12 text-center

description: Alert with 4 semantic variants using border-left treatment
example: info/success/warning/error. Left border 4px in semantic color. Icon matches variant. Title: font-medium. Body: text-sm text-muted-foreground
anti_pattern: Generic gray box for all alert types — loses urgency signaling

description: Figma file page organization for production projects
example: Pages: Cover / Design System / Components / Screens / Prototypes / Archive. No mixing components with screens. Archive not delete deprecated
anti_pattern: All content in single page — unmanageable at scale

description: Layer naming convention for clean developer handoff
example: Frames: PascalCase matching component names. Groups: descriptive kebab-case. No default names (Frame 42 Rectangle 8). Prefix icons: icon/
anti_pattern: Default Figma names — developers can't identify elements

description: Page header organism: title + breadcrumb + action area
example: Auto Layout horizontal space-between. Left: vertical (breadcrumb text-xs muted) + (title text-2xl font-bold). Right: horizontal gap-2 action buttons
anti_pattern: No consistent page header — each page invents its own

description: Metric row for trading dashboard: pair + direction badge + entry + current + pnl
example: 5-column horizontal layout. Direction: Badge long=blue short=red. PnL: font-mono positive=green negative=red
anti_pattern: PnL as plain text — missed semantic color coding
tailwind_mapping: grid grid-cols-5 items-center px-4 py-3 text-sm font-mono [data-positive]:text-green-500 [data-negative]:text-red-500

description: Equity curve AreaChart production spec
example: Area fill: primary/20 opacity. Stroke: primary. ReferenceLine at start capital: muted dashed. Tooltip: formatted as $X,XXX. XAxis: date format MMM DD
anti_pattern: Line chart without fill — loses visual equity sense. No reference line — hard to see gains vs losses

description: Dark theme surface layering (background → card → popover → overlay)
example: background: hsl(224 71% 4%). card: hsl(224 71% 6%). popover/modal: hsl(224 71% 8%). Tooltip: hsl(224 71% 10%). Always use tokens not values
anti_pattern: All surfaces same color — no depth hierarchy

description: Responsive breakpoint strategy for dashboard components
example: sm=640px tablet-portrait, md=768px tablet-landscape, lg=1024px desktop. Sidebar: hidden below lg (becomes bottom nav). Grid: 1-col mobile → 2-col md → 3-col lg
anti_pattern: No mobile breakpoints — assumes desktop only

description: Using Figma MCP to analyze and spec production designs
example: 1. Screenshot with Figma MCP 2. Claude analyzes grid/spacing/type 3. Map values to token system 4. Spec in Figma using tokens 5. Generate with v0.dev
anti_pattern: Copying raw values from screenshot without mapping to token system

description: Workflow for cloning best-in-class Figma designs ethically
example: 1. Find on Mobbin/Screenlane 2. Screenshot 3. Analyze with Claude 4. Map to your token system 5. Build with tokens in Figma 6. Use as spec for v0.dev generation
anti_pattern: Direct copy of community template — style mismatch with existing system
